subject: Re: [junit] When running a test suite a private static final field 	Object is null. Why?
msgSnippet: If you have static code, the execution of the static code flows from the top of the file to the bottom.  It could be possible for this code to execute above
messageBody:
If you have static code, the execution of the static code flows from the top
of the file to the bottom. It could be possible for this code to execute
above the setting of the LOCK variable. At which time the variable will be
null.

On Thu, Jun 3, 2010 at 5:20 AM, bes_ez <bes_ez@...> wrote:

>
>
> Hi,
>
> I am running an instrumentation test suite with a field like this:
>
> private final static Object LOCK = new Object();
>
> And at one point in the test, the LOCK variable becomes null. How is that
> even possible?
>
> Thanks!
>
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
